title: Job Openings at ASA Security
content:
ASA Security provides strategic, operational, and tactical solutions for homeland security, general security, and defense markets worldwide. Within those markets for the past 22 years, ASA continually offers her customers wide range of services which includes system integration, project management, conceptual R & D, consultancy, training, risk assessment and business development. ASA Security operates in the defense and security sectors and successfully manages numerous civilian activities. ASA works independently and in cooperation with leading industries and companies locally and abroad.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	Education: Minimum of a Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field. An advanced Degree or certification in Sales/Marketing is an advantage.
	Experience: At least 3-5 years of proven experience in sales, preferably in security services or related industries.


Professional Skills:
Sales Expertise:


	Strong track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.
	Ability to develop and implement effective sales strategies tailored to the physical security services industry.


Market Knowledge:


	In-depth understanding of the Lagos market, Abuja marketand its business environment.
	Familiarity with the various market segments: residential, corporate, retail, and industrial.


Client Acquisition:


	Expertise in identifying and acquiring new clients in high-demand segments, such as luxury estates, retail outlets, and corporate offices.


Negotiation Skills:


	Ability to negotiate contracts and service agreements with high-level decision-makers.


Personal Attributes:
Communication Skills:


	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Ability to build strong relationships with clients.


Interpersonal Skills:


	A people-oriented personality with strong networking abilities.


Results-Driven:


	Focused on achieving and surpassing sales objectives.
	Proactive and self-motivated with the ability to work independently and in a team.


Integrity and Professionalism:


	High ethical standards and respect for client confidentiality.


Technical Proficiency:
CRM Knowledge:


	Proficiency in using Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software for tracking leads, clients, and sales activities.


Reporting Skills:


	Ability to prepare detailed sales reports and forecasts.


Additional Requirements:
Mobility:


	Must be willing to travel within Lagos and neighboring areas for client meetings.


Adaptability:


	Flexibility to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.


References:


	At least two professional references from previous employers.


Remuneration


	Salary N150,000 Monthly
	Sales Commission of up to N1,000,000 and above in a month


Application Closing Date: 21st August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated CV to: hr.asa2023@gmail.com using "Sales Manager - Lagos as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Sales Coordinator (Guards Division)

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Position Overview


	We are seeking a Sales Coordinator to join our high-performing Guards Division.
	This is an exciting opportunity for a goal-driven individual who is passionate about sales and client relationship development in the private security industry.
	You will play a key role in driving revenue growth by sourcing and scheduling high-value meetings with potential clients such as estates, corporate offices, retail chains, logistics firms, and private schools in need of manned guarding services.
	Monthly Target: Schedule a minimum of 8–10 meetings with strategic prospects


Key Responsibilities


	Identify and qualify prospective strategic clients through research and outbound calls
	Schedule high-potential meetings for the Business Development Manager(s)
	Maintain CRM records of leads, meetings scheduled, and follow-ups
	Coordinate closely with the sales and marketing teams to align outreach efforts
	Support proposal preparation, client follow-ups, and calendar management


Requirements & Qualifications


	Candidates should possess an OND/HND/B.Sc. in Business, Marketing, or related fields
	Minimum of 2 years in a sales, telesales, or business development support role
	Experience in the security, logistics, facilities, or service-based industry is an advantage


Skills:


	Strong communication and persuasive phone skills
	CRM and Microsoft Office proficiency
	Ability to work independently and meet monthly KPIs
	Professional appearance and excellent interpersonal skills.


Salary and Benefit


	N300,000 / Month
	Commission: N10,000 per qualified meeting scheduled with strategic clients
	Dynamic and supportive work environment
	Opportunity to grow within the company’s expanding commercial team
	Access to experienced leadership and career development support.


Application Closing Date: 21st August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief Cover Letter to: hr.asa2023a@gmail.com using "Sales Coordinator Application - Guards Division" as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Bike Rider

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Skills and Qualifications


	A minimum of Secondary School Leaving Certificate
	3 - 5 years of relevant work experience.
	Riders Card
	Proven experience as a dispatch rider or relevant position.
	Familiarity with relevant routes.
	Must enjoy motorcycling and be a skilled rider.
	Ability to communicate, read and write.
	Organizational and multitasking abilities
	Ability to work under pressure
	Have good numeracy skills for delivery and expenses records.
	Polite and able to get along with people.
	Must live within the Island.


Application Closing Date: 10th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a brief Cover Letter to: hr.asa2023a@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

        Jamub Group is a conglomerate of different companies duly registered in line with relevant laws of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, the attribute of which makes us a non-cyclical organisation. Established to deliver solutions in the various areas of our business interests, our delivery model spans Business to Business (B2B), Business to Government (B2G) and Business to Consumer (B2C) in the economic value chain with a range of products and services which cut across the industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Control and Audit Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Internal Control and Audit Officer is responsible for evaluating and improving the effectiveness of internal controls, risk management, and governance processes within the organization.
	This role involves conducting audits, analysing business processes, and ensuring compliance with internal policies and external regulations.
	The role requires a thorough understanding of financial reporting, risk assessment, and process improvement.


Responsibilities


	Conduct periodic risk assessment to identify operational and financial risks and recommend risk-mitigating measures.
	Identify gaps and recommend internal control measures, including to appraise the adequacy of control systems.
	Ensure protection of the organization’s assets against fraud and theft.
	Prepare audit reports and communicate findings in a timely manner.
	Verify the validity and certainty of goal achievement.
	Participate in the development and implementation a detailed audit plan.
	Verify the accuracy of financial statements, reports, accounting system.
	Ensure compliance to regulatory requirements, corporate policies and procedures.
	Investigate identified and reported cases, including following up to ensure timely resolution.
	Recommend or provide requisite guidance on control for effectiveness and efficiency of operations.
	Other responsibilities as assigned.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Accounting, Finance, Civil Engineering, Quantity Surveyor, Economics or a relevant field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar position in Construction industry.
	Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA, CIA) is an added advantage.
	In-depth understanding of accounting and auditing standards.
	Hands on experience with relevant software and proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
	Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.
	Ability to maintain objective view and confidentiality.
	Commitment to ethical standards and high level of personal and professional integrity.
	Proactive approach to problem-solving.
	Professional level verbal and written communication with good report writing and presentation skills.
	Ability to handle multiple tasks in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
	Ability to work independently with little or no supervision.
	Good interpersonal and organizational skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications, including Resume and a Cover Letter to: jobs@jamubgroup.com using "Internal Control and Audit Officer" as the subject of the email.

        Tribitat Real Estate offers commercial and residential real estate development services to individuals, public and private organisations through the provision of high quality affordable construction management, project management and entitlement processing services.

We recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: General Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The General Manager will oversee the end-to-end operations of real estate projects, with a strong focus on supervising large-scale building and infrastructure developments.
	The role requires strategic leadership, construction oversight, team coordination, and financial accountability.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage day-to-day operations of real estate development projects
	Supervise large-scale construction projects from planning to completion
	Coordinate architects, contractors, engineers, and vendors
	Drive sales, leasing, and marketing strategies for completed properties
	Ensure compliance with building codes, safety standards, and project timelines
	Oversee budgeting, cost control, and resource planning
	Lead site inspections, progress reviews, and quality assurance
	Report regularly to executive leadership and stakeholders.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, Real Estate, or related fields
	Minimum of 5 years in real estate/project management, with hands-on building supervision experience
	Strong leadership, communication, and contract negotiation skills
	Proven ability to manage large teams and multi-million-naira projects
	Must reside within the Lekki-Epe expressway of Lagos State, Nigeria.

Business Adviser Job at Japan Tobacco International (JTI)




        
    

        
        Japan Tobacco International (JTI) is a member of the Japan Tobacco Group of Companies. Our 45,000 people come from all over the world, representing more than 100 nationalities. We market world-renowned brands in more than 130 countries with 409 offices, 29 factories, and 8 research & development centers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Adviser

Job ID: 101307
Job Location: Lagos

Position Description
     

            
    




	The incumbent, working very closely with the Area Sales Manager will be responsible for all aspects of coordination and collaboration with the distributor on the sales and distribution operation and on the trade marketing field force deployment and monitoring.
	His/Her role is to ensure that distribution and merchandising strategy as well as the KPIs agreed upon with the distributor are being met.
	He/She will work closely with the distributor & Agency staff in the management and execution of trade and consumer activation programs as well as monitor implementation and competitive activity.


Main Areas of Responsibilities
Volume & Market Share delivery


	Ensure volume & market share growth & deliver on location volume targets while reporting any changes/challenges to the Area Sales Maanger.


Distributor Management:


	Working in liaison with the distributor staff; effectively manage the sales and marketing activities in the location in order to ensure the attainment of set objectives for our brands as set by management. Eg 1. New brand launches, 2. Route to Market (RTM) plans & strategies, 3. Monitoring price etc.


Responsible for effective Implementation of Sales & Distribution:


	Merchandising, through effective territory planning & field force deployment ( Indirect Sales Force/Sales Support). Monitors progress and recommends corrective action where necessary.


Reporting:


	Gather and disseminate accurate and timely market and intelligence information on JTI and competitors activities in order to contribute to timeliness and quality of decisions being made by management by providing daily, weekly, monthly updates with regards to all sales & marketing activities, photographs of trade activities, carry out audits on our stock availability etc.


External Environment:


	This is ever changing due to inherent volatility of the political ,socio-economic & legal framework; hence the need to ensure a full & clear understanding of the external environment in our market (particularly Legal & M&S programmes implementation) & work appropriately with the internal team & distributor to ensure we are complying fully with industry standards & government regulations


Job Requirements


	A University degree or equivalent
	3-5 years of experience in sales & distribution / channel management / Implementation of consumer and Trade Marketing Plans.


Functional Skills:


	Distributor and field force planning and management
	Trade marketing and POC consumer activation
	Shelf space management
	Category management
	Field intelligence, data gathering, KPI monitoring / reporting
	Negotiation skills
	External environment (taxation, trade pricing, external / corporate relations, legal)
	Deep knowledge of Customer services
